data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Don't be afraid of the dark. Our Oatmeal Stout is a little shy but friendly, just like you. You two are gonna hit it off right away. Most beer is brewed entirely with barley but this one includes some oats, a closely-related cereal grain which adds a silky mouthfeel with creamy, long-lasting foam and lace. No harsh burnt notes here, we prefer bready, toasty and rich chocolate notes with a nice soft earthy note from fuggle hops. Full-bodied, warming, and smoooooooth.  Employees at the Civil Life have a long running joke with their doctors that tell them to eat oatmeal and they say, "What? Drink my oatmeal?"  Then they immediately end the appointment and return to "work".

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. A roasted malt character which is caramel-like and chocolate-like should be evident - smooth and not bitter. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas (chocolate and nut-like) are prominent. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

breweries.name: Civil Life Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of fine crafted ales. 

We are a local craft brewery situated in the great Tower Grove South neighborhood. We currently have 8 beers on draft a British Bitter, English Best, American Brown, German Wheat, Scottish Ale, Vienna Lager, Black Lager, Munich Dunkel Lager. We built a very traditional pub inside of an old warehouse. Best yet, our beers can be found around town. Head to our web-site at www.thecivillife.com for a listing. Hope you can enjoy a pint sometime soon and check us out. Cheers!

breweries.name: Miner Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in the heart of the Black Hills, and owned and operated by the same family behind the award-winning Prairie Berry Winery, Miner Brewing Company produces craft beers that are both traditional in nature, and yet truly “South Dakota”.

With five generations of family lineage handcrafting beverages in South Dakota, and with 15 years as winemaker and owner of Prairie Berry Winery, Brewmaster Sandi Vojta is inspired by the traditional brewing styles of her family’s European heritage. By infusing regional and seasonal ingredients into the recipes handed down to her, she has skillfully adapted those traditional styles to create craft beers with a regional character, setting each distinctly apart from other microbrews.

All of our beers are produced in small, 15-barrel fermenters, allowing us to keep each batch small enough to maintain microbrew quality and a close attention to detail at all times. The results are craft beers that are approachable and distinctive, to be enjoyed by craft beer novices and enthusiasts alike.

We invite you to experience Miner Brewing for yourself, as we open our Tap Room in Hill City this fall 2013. Stop on by for a flight or a glass, hang out to enjoy our seasonal selections, and stay a while for a little South Dakota hospitality. 

Join us in the Black Hills and discover your own pint of gold.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Our most recent addition to the lineup, this dark, full-bodied roasty ale finishes with a slight oatmeal note on the back end.  Oatmeal stout is sweeter than a dry stout, and the oats provide a slightly creamy mouth feel and complexity.  It has a slight roasted-grain flavor and aroma, which helps with the dry finish.  A subtle background fruity/earthy character from fermentation and hop notes round out the overall impression of this beer.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 500 people over an 31 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. 100% family-owned and independent, our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and lagers.

The addition of 10% oatmeal gives this ale a distinctive smooth and silky mouth feel, and yes, it’s not just for breakfast anymore.

breweries.name: Longwood Brewpub
breweries.description:
Longwood Brew Pub & Restaurant stands proud as the "jewel in the crown" of Longwood Station. Nestled within beautiful landscaping and natural west coast wilderness the Longwood Brew Pub is easily accessible via the Nanaimo Parkway from Victoria or Duke Point ferry terminal or the old Island Highway from Departure Bay ferry terminal and all points north. Longwood Brew Pub is central Vancouver Island's first Brew Pub and Nanaimo's favorite rendezvous destination.

The Brewery at the Longwood stands proud as one of the first images that you will see as you enter the main entrance. The Primary Brew House is located behind storefront glass on the left of our host- stand and is a flurry of activity as our brewer Harley Smith creates his magic and art 3 to 4 times a week. Every Saturday is tour day with reservations requested for the ever-popular 3:00 pm brewery tour and tasting. Only those patrons 19 or older may participate in the tasting component of the tour.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: No affectations, and certainly no gimmicks. Brewed truly to style, the aroma of bakers chocolate and fresh roasted coffee playfully waft from the glass. A rich blend of kilned malts give way to creamy caramel, subtle roastiness, and a hint of vanilla. The oats impart depth of character and a velveteen texture that rounds out all the flavors. Recommended pairings: Nutella filled crepes with shaved hazelnuts and a dusting of cocoa powder. Or as an appetizer, warm sourdough bread with Gruyer.

breweries.name: Roc Brewing Company
breweries.description: When Roc Brewing Co. began in the crisp cellaring walls of a suburban Rochester basement, they never imaged the future that was set forward. The ever infectious brewing bug had bitten both homebrewers Jonathan Mervine and Chris Spinelli. From the time the yeast was pitched it was unanimous this was their future. Joined by the emboldened encouragement of Chris’ mom and third partner Patty Spinelli, she was hooked by first sip. The new family began their many trials and tribulations of brewing, three tier law, legalese and to much to their chagrin ROC Brewing Co. was founded.

Old 690 Brewing Company is one of the first farm breweries to open in the state of Virginia. Our mission is to brew and serve a unique yet balanced variety of fresh craft beers including several seasonal ales that utilize crops grown on the 10 acre property. Come out to beautiful Loudoun County to see our hops and enjoy our unique tasting room Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays where we serve tasting flights, pints and growlers to go. We have food trucks all weekend, but feel free to bring your own food. We are also family, kid and dog friendly. We also make and serve our own root beer!

If you are interested in hosting a special, private or corporate event please contact events@old690.com. Special event hours are available 7 days a week pending availability.

Looking forward to seeing you soon at Old 690!!

breweries.name: Cogstone Brewing Company
breweries.description: Cogstones are an ancient artifact from the American Southwest. They have been found along the Santa Ana River and some are believed to date from 3500 BC. Chemical evidence of fermented barley, coincidentally, has been found dating to around the same time. The Cogstone's function remains an enigma like the origin of ancient beer. No one knows exactly how beer was invented, but the process has been evolving ever since. We ,at cogstone, are more than just another "cog" in the quest to produce the perfect pint. Using history and the senses, our goal is to produce classic styles with a twist of the new. The resultant product will approach the upper limits on the continuum of perfection.

breweries.name: Appleton Beer Factory
breweries.description:
From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.

We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: Our Oatmeal Stout is so named for the 10% oat content of the grains. You will find this stout to pour black with a nice thick head that remains. As you taste this beer you will find coffee and dark chocolate as the dominating flavors with a sweet finale. We left this beer with a lighter carbonation so you can enjoy the true flavor of this beer that we find tastes its best between 50-55°F.

breweries.name: Hub City Brewing Co
breweries.description: Set in the heart of the Midwest, the Hub City Brewing Company is located five miles east of the historic town of Oelwein, Iowa. Founded in 1872 on a plot of land nestled amongst the fields, the city served as a hub for three major branches of the Chicago Great Western Railway, earning it the nickname of "Hub City" during the heyday of the railroad. Our beers pay homage to this historic Iowa town and the romantic era of the iron horse.

It’s traveling the world to taste and to learn. It’s weekends in the garage leading to neighborhood get togethers. It’s the curiosity that turned into a passion to create a more flavorful beer. We are Grainworks Brewing.

Built on the same soil from which Cincinnati’s greatest breweries harvested their grain, Grainworks Brewing pours that rich history into every glass. It’s beer with a heritage. It’s beer with a soul.

Grainworks Brewing looks forward to sharing our passion with friends who seek a lively atmosphere, a friendly crew, and the best craft beer. Raise a glass, friends, to love of the craft - from soil to soul!

breweries.name: Tröegs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

breweries.name: Founders Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founders Brewing Company, founded by Mike Stevens and Dave Engbers produced its first beer in November of 1997. Built out of a dream and a passion for home brewing, what started out as a hobby quickly became a thriving business.  As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer.

Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer. breweries.name: Brown's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Back in 1993, before the surge of craft breweries, Garry and Kelly Brown opened a brewpub in then-blighted Troy, NY, more or less to make the beer they wanted to drink. The Browns were undaunted and compelled by a need to share what they made with everyone looking for something new and fresh. Brown's Brewing Company has become what it is today through grit and determination with two very popular taprooms, an R&D pilot brewery in Troy, NY and a full scale production brewery and canning facility in North Hoosick, NY. Distributed in three states, Brown's cans and draughts are among the most enjoyable and celebrated locally brewed and hand crafted ales and lagers around.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Backroom Brewery
breweries.description:
Backroom Brewery is a boutique farm brewery nestled in the heart of the Shenandoah River Valley.  We began as a herb farm, growing culinary and medicinal herbs for the garden center trade. 
 
Our herb farm, Sunflower Cottage, grows 120,000 potted herb plants each spring from seeds and cuttings to sell to other garden centers and to our own customers. 
 
In the fall of 2012, we built our hops field.  After all, hops are the herbs that flavor beer.  Hops provide the bitter balance to the sweet malt that feeds yeast, which ferments beer.
 
In 2013 we began the process of creating an ordinance in Warren County to accomodate farm breweries.  By late spring, the process was complete and Backroom Brewery became the first farm brewery in the Northern Shenandoah Valley.
 
Our first hop harvest in August of 2013 was bountiful.  We were brewing in small batches and planning our brewery construction.  In the spring of 2014 we began construction and finished our brewery building plus equipment installation by July of 2014. 
 
Life is good and we are living the dream. 
 
We now have nearly 20 beer recipes approved by the State of VA. 
 
Our tasting room bustles and our scratch kitchen cranks out delicious dishes prepared with our own fresh herbs and farm grown produce in season.
 
In the spring , summer and fall, gardens abound, families enjoy the farm, the scenery, the corn hole, the labyrinth and chalk boards. Pets are welcome.
 
We host 3 annual events, The Virginia Herb Festival (June), BRB Hop Harvest Party (August) and BRB Holiday Market (November). 
 
You are cordially invited to come and drink our beer, eat, play and spend some time.

breweries.name: Horsefly Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Horsefly Brewing Company decided they wanted the name to represent something “local”.  They couldn’t spell Uncompahgre so they settled on Horsefly, which is a peak 10,000 feet high on the Uncompahgre Plateau west of Montrose.

In April of ’09 Horsefly Brewing Company started brewing recipes and fine tuning them.  In May ’09 construction began on the current location.  After lots of sweat and tears, (from watching the bar top drip on the floor) and with the help of a lot of friends and family, the doors finally opened September 9th, 2009.   09-09-09 was supposed to be lucky someone said.

In September of ’10 the doors opened at our new & current location. This was a 4 month adventure into remodeling the building to suit as brewery.

hops.name: Cascade
hops.description: Cascade was created in the United States as an open-pollinated cross between Fuggle and Serebrianker. Its instantly recognizable grapefruit, floral aroma is characteristic of many American ales. Cascade is also one of the easiest hop varieties to grow; it can grow well under less than ideal conditions or in short growing seasons, and unlike most varieties, if started from a good rhizome a Cascade can produce a good crop even in its first growing season.

hops.name: Galena
hops.description: Galena is a high-alpha hop variety developed by the Iowa state breeding program in 1968 by open pollination from Brewer's Gold and released to the trade in 1978. Because of its strong, clean bitterness, it is said to be among the most common bittering hops used in America. It is sensitive to growing conditions and can be more difficult to grow outside of the Northwest. Galena has a strong fruity/black currant aroma similar to Bullion.

hops.name: Willamette
hops.description: Released from the U.S.D.A. hop breeding program in 1976, Willamette is a triploid (some sources say tetraploid) seedling of Fuggle bred to be easier to grow in the United States. It's still less vigorous than most modern hop varieties, but easier to grow in most areas than the very fussy Fuggle. Willamette has a mild, grassy, floral and slightly spicy aroma similar to Fuggle, and is often used as a substitute, especially in the United States where Fuggle does not grow well. Willamette is extensively planted in the U.S. Pacific Northwest.

malt.name: Barley - Roasted

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: While its cascading rich black color will be familiar to Stout enthusiasts, ours is decidedly different. It's made with naked oats from the UK, for one. Smooth and slightly sweet, with hints of coffee, caramel and chocolate. Served with a Nitrogen/CO2 mix, it is sold only on draught in select places.

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. A roasted malt character which is caramel-like and chocolate-like should be evident - smooth and not bitter. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas (chocolate and nut-like) are prominent. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

breweries.name: Summit Brewing Company
breweries.description: Summit Brewing Company is a regional craft brewery in St. Paul, Minnesota that brews a wide selection of popular beers. It is sometimes mistakenly believed to be a microbrewery, even though Summit's output is in the top 50 of breweries in the United States, approximately 80,000 barrels of beer per year. Their flagship beer, an American pale ale (branded Summit Extra Pale Ale) is especially popular in the Twin Cities area.

Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

data.name: Oatmeal Stout
data.description: This classic English style stout is a throwback to the mid 1800’s when oats were first added to this style in order to make them “nourishing” and were often prescribed to nursing mothers for that reason. English and Scottish breweries often made sweeter stouts than their Irish cousins and oatmeal stouts are a lot different from the classic dry Irish stouts like our Cobblestone. Oatmeal stouts are sweeter from the additional malts used (including caramel malt) and have a very silky texture from the small quantity of oats used in the mash. Our version is slightly drier than typical of this style but we make up for it by accentuating the apparent sweetness and smoothness of the beer by Nitrogen-charging it.

Our approach to exceptional brewing is all about attention to detail, not cutting corners and innovating yet staying true to the principles of brewing – respecting the four core ingredients used to make beer: grain, yeast, hops and water. breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.
